alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:46AM EST until December 19 at 7:45PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Near Hershey affecting Lebanon and Dauphin Counties. Swatara Creek At Harper Tavern affecting Lebanon and Schuylkill Counties. For the Swatara Creek...including Harper Tavern, Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek near Hershey. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The right, or north bank begins to overflow. Several roadways upstream of the gage are affected by high water. At 8.0 feet, The right, or north bank overflows. Several roads are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:02 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:02 AM EST Tuesday was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of just over 8 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
